parts.contentJson: {"text":"Design a dark-themed price reference website for retro game consoles. Style: minimal data-focused design like PriceCharting.com. Features: price graph (280px height), stats cards (no hover), listing table (compact rows). Color: dark bg (#0f1419), cyan accents (#00d9ff) for links only, green (#00ff88) for prices. No gradients, no decorative elements, institutional and trustworthy. Desktop-first, 1200px max width."}

{"text":"I'll create a minimal, data-focused price reference website for retro game consoles with the dark theme and institutional design you specified. Let me start by checking the current setup and installing the necessary charting library.","textMode":"visible_message"}

{"text":"This is a request for a price reference website for retro game consoles with a very specific dark theme and minimal design. Let me break down the requirements:

1. Dark themed (#0f1419 background)
2. Minimal, data-focused design similar to PriceCharting.com
3. Features needed:
   - Price graph (280px height)
   - Stats cards (no hover effects)
   - Listing table (compact rows)
4. Colors:
   - Dark bg: #0f1419
   - Cyan accents: #00d9ff (for links only)
   - Green: #00ff88 (for prices)
5. No gradients, no decorative elements
6. Institutional and trustworthy feel
7. Desktop-first, 1200px max width

This is a PureFrontend request - it's just a website displaying data with no backend persistence or API requirements. I'll need:
- A chart library (recharts)
- Clean, minimal design
- Mock data for retro game consoles
- Price graphs and tables

Let me start by checking if recharts is installed and then build out the components.","signature":""}
{"text":"Good! I can see recharts is already installed. Now let me create the components for this minimal, data-focused price reference website.","textMode":"visible_message"}

{"toolCallId":"toolu_01BQj4twVoyMuProWkjATLUc","toolName":"think","argsJson":"{\"thought\":\"I'll create:\\n1. A main App.tsx with the overall layout\\n2. A PriceChart component for the graph (280px height)\\n3. A StatsCards component for the statistics (no hover)\\n4. A ListingsTable component with compact rows\\n5. Custom theme in theme.css to support the dark colors\\n\\nMock data will include:\\n- Retro consoles like NES, SNES, Sega Genesis, PlayStation 1, N64, etc.\\n- Price history data for charts\\n- Recent listings data for the table\\n\\nColor scheme:\\n- Background: #0f1419\\n- Cyan for links: #00d9ff\\n- Green for prices: #00ff88\\n- Gray text for secondary content\\n\\nMax width 1200px, desktop-first, no gradients or decorative elements.\\n\"}"}

{"text":"Perfect! I've created a minimal, data-focused price reference website for retro game consoles with the exact specifications you requested. The design features a dark background (#0f1419), cyan links (#00d9ff), and green prices (#00ff88) with no gradients or decorative elements. The layout includes a 280px height price chart, clean stats cards without hover effects, and a compact listings table, all contained within a 1200px max-width desktop-first design that feels institutional and trustworthy.

Suggestions for enhancements:
- Add filtering options to view different time ranges on the price chart
- Implement console switching to view data for different retro systems
- Add sorting functionality to the listings table by clicking column headers","textMode":"visible_message"}
{"text":"make the same chart that the one on gg.deals"}

{"text":"The user wants me to make the chart look like the one on gg.deals. Let me think about what gg.deals charts typically look like:

1. They have a more sophisticated tooltip that shows on hover
2. The chart area typically has a filled gradient beneath the line
3. They often have multiple data points and smooth curves
4. The styling is typically more polished with better tooltips
5. They might have dots on the line that appear on hover
6. The grid lines are usually more subtle
7. The chart usually has a filled area under the line with gradient

Let me update the PriceChart component to match the gg.deals style more closely.","signature":""}

The chart now features an area chart with a gradient fill beneath the line, a cleaner custom tooltip that appears on hover, horizontal-only grid lines, an active dot that shows when you hover over data points, and a dashed cursor line for better data point tracking - all while maintaining your dark theme aesthetic.","textMode":"visible_message"}
